intro: Weitenwebera glomerata var. mollis, commonly known as the silky weitenwebera, is a flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
